Api-Key.name: Authorization
Api-Key.description:
Prefix your API key with "Api-Key " to authorize requests.
For example, the full header would be `Authorization: Api-Key TENOVI_API_KEY`

get.summary: Get detailed information about a single gateway that has been previously associated with your account.
get.description:
NOTE, This endpoint can only be used for retrieving information about gateways that have either been
previously linked with one or more of your own devices (e.g. via an Activation/Fulfillment request) or
Pre-Activated via a bulk order.
It can NOT be used to "pre-validate" a gateway ID that is not already associated with your account.

The 12-digit Gateway ID must be included in the URL with NO HYPHENS.

For the last_signal_strength field, a signal strength value of 30 or above is considered excellent,
while a signal strength value of 10 or below is considered poor.

The last_checkin_time field indicates the last time the Gateway connected to our network.

The assigned_on field indicates when the gateway was assigned to your client account.

The shipped_on field indicates when the gateway was dropshipped by Tenovi (if applicable).

The whitelisted_devices field provides a JSON list of devices (by sensor_code) whitelisted with this gateway.
Note, only one device per sensor_code can be whitelisted to a Gateway at one time.
Use the hwi-device-types endpoint or see tenovi.com/api-docs to match sensor_codes to devices.
Valid options for the "status" field are: "RE" (for Requested) and "CO" (for Confirmed)

(DEPRECATED) This endpoint will also return a list of key-value properties for each gateway

get.summary: Lists all changes to the Hardware UUID for HWI Devices
get.description:
Note, the "hwi-device-id" value is stored in the "object_id" field for this history table, as it is used to log
changes for multiple device types.

You can optionally filter by a specific hwi-device-id using the "object_id" query parameter to get the history of a
single device. You can also search for all records with a given hardware_uuid using the "search" query parameter

get.summary: Lists all Bulk Order Requests. If getting a list, results will be paginated.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

get.summary: Lists all Bulk Order Requests. If getting a list, results will be paginated.
Retrieves valid device types for your account.
get.description:
These can be used to activate/request new devices via the hwi-devices endpoint using the "name" field.
This endpoint can also be used to get static images of devices, or to get the up-front and shipping fees for
specific devices.

get.summary: Retrieves valid device types for your account.
get.description:
These can be used to activate/request new devices via the hwi-devices endpoint using the "name" field.
This endpoint can also be used to get static images of devices, or to get the up-front and shipping fees for
specific devices.

get.summary: Lists all or Reads a single HWI Device
get.description: To read a single HWI Device, the ID must be included in the URL.

post.summary: Creates a new HWI Device with optional Fulfillment Request
post.description:
A nested Device object is required. Within this object, the Device name must exactly match the name of a
Device Type associated with your account. You may use the hwi-device-types endpoint to view a complete list
of Device Types associated with your account.

If you want to link a HWI Device to a specific Tenovi Gateway, include the Gateway ID with no hyphens in the
hardware_uuid field of the nested Device object. For Transtek devices, this field should be the IMEI number
printed on the box. Note: The request will still succeed even if you use an invalid Gateway ID, but the
status field in the returned data will be "Unknown Gateway ID".

For Gateway-connected devices, every Device Type has a Sensor Code that represents its device family (for
example, all BPM devices use Sensor Code = 10). For most Device Types, only one Device per Sensor Code can be
associated with a single Gateway at a time, even if they have different names. However, some Device Types also
require an additional "sensor_id" to be included, which is used to allow multiple Devices with the same Sensor
Code to be associated with a single Gateway. Please refer to tenovi.com/hwi-device-overview/ for more details
regarding the "sensor_id" values required for specific Device Types. Please refer to the hwi-device-types
endpoint to lookup the Sensor Code for each Device Type and whether or not a sensor_id is required.

If you need a device to be dropshipped to a specific user, a nested Fulfillment Request object must be included
in the Device object and the hardware_uuid field must be set to NULL (if you want a Gateway to be included with
the device) or to an existing Gateway ID (if, for example, a patient already has a Gateway with one device, and
you simply want a second device sent to them without a new Gateway).

Note, the Fulfillment Request object has three optional flags: "client_will_fulfill", "require_signature", and
"ship_gateway_only".

Set the "client_will_fulfill" flag to TRUE if you wish to complete a Fulfillment Request internally (via the
Tenovi  dashboard). Otherwise, Tenovi will complete the request (shipping and device charges may apply).

Set the "require_signature" flag to TRUE to request signature confirmation of delivery. Additional charges may
apply.

Set the "ship_gateway_only" flag to TRUE if the patient already has the Device you wish to activate, and only
the Gateway needs to be shipped. In this case, you will only be charged for the Gateway.

You can also optionally link this Device to a Patient by including a nested Patient object. If you do this,
the "external_id" field can be used to uniquely identify this Patient. For example,
if you edit the name or phone_number of a Patient, those fields will be updated for all
Devices with the same Patient external_id. We thus recommend Clients use a unique Patient
identifier from their own systems for this field (hence the name "external_id").

Note, the external_id value in the Patient object will be included in the "patient_id" field in all FULFILLMENT
and MEASUREMENT webhook callbacks, allowing Clients to link those callbacks to a patient in their systems, even
if the related hardware_uuid values change (for example, if a Tenovi Gateway is replaced). Thus, the use of this
field is strongly recommended. See the Webhooks documentation for more details.

If a phone number is included in the Patient object, we may use it to text/call the patient to resolve
customer service requests or for any optional services (for example, sms shipping notifications). If you have
not obtained the patient's consent to receive SMS messages, please set the sms_opt_in field to False.

If the physician field is included in the Patient object, this data will be forwarded to our fulfillment team
(if dropshipping is requested) to allow for any per-provider shipping customizations (additional charges may
apply).

Please note, the patient_id and patient_phone_number fields are deprecated in favor of the nested Patient
object, but remain available for backwards compatibility.

get.summary: Lists all measurement data for a given HWI Device
get.description:
The root HWI Device id must be included in the url.

Note, the "timestamp" field represents the time the measurement was actually taken, as measured by the device.
The "created" field represents the time the measurement was created on our server. For backwards compatibility,
the MEASUREMENT Webhook posts the "timestamp" value with both the "timestamp" and "created" key, which may not
match the "created" value returned here. Please note the difference between these two fields when filtering via
query parameters.

get.summary: Lists all or reads a single Property for a given HWI Device
get.description:
These properties can be used for controlling device-specific settings (e.g. the Step Goals for the Tenovi
Watch), or for adding custom, client-defined tags to individual devices (as long as the keys used do not conflict
with a pre-defined Tenovi key). See https://tenovi.com/api-docs for a list of device-specific Properties.

All devices support a "measurement_webhook_id" property that configures a Device to only send measurement data to
a single Webhook (specified by that Webhook’s primary ID).

For device-specific settings, the "synced" field can be used to check if the setting has been successfully
applied to the device or not. Note, syncing often requires the device to connect to our network, which, for
some devices, only occurs when a measurement is taken).

post.summary: Creates a new HWI Device Property with a key-value pair
post.description:
This endpoint can be used to manage any device-specific properties, such as setting the step goal
on the Tenovi Watch device. Please see our detailed Device documentation at https://tenovi.com/api-docs
for more details.

This endpoint can also be used for adding any client-specific properties clients wish to use for
internal purposes (for example, to tag devices), as long as the keys used do not conflict with any special
use keys described in the Tenovi documentation.

Note, keys must be unique for a given device. If you try and create a property with an existing key,
the existing key-value pair will simply be updated instead.

get.summary: Lists all or reads a single Property for a given HWI Device
get.description:
These properties can be used for controlling device-specific settings (e.g. the Step Goals for the Tenovi
Watch), or for adding custom, client-defined tags to individual devices (as long as the keys used do not conflict
with a pre-defined Tenovi key). See https://tenovi.com/api-docs for a list of device-specific Properties.

All devices support a "measurement_webhook_id" property that configures a Device to only send measurement data to
a single Webhook (specified by that Webhook’s primary ID).

For device-specific settings, the "synced" field can be used to check if the setting has been successfully
applied to the device or not. Note, syncing often requires the device to connect to our network, which, for
some devices, only occurs when a measurement is taken).

put.description:
You may only update the value for a given key-value pair.

Note, since the POST method falls back to a PUT if the key provided already exists, you may use that method
to update properties without having to lookup the id for the desired key-value pair first.

patch.description:
You may only update the value for a given key-value pair.

Note, since the POST method falls back to a PUT if the key provided already exists, you may use that method
to update properties without having to lookup the id for the desired key-value pair first.

delete.summary: Lists all or reads a single Property for a given HWI Device
delete.description:
These properties can be used for controlling device-specific settings (e.g. the Step Goals for the Tenovi
Watch), or for adding custom, client-defined tags to individual devices (as long as the keys used do not conflict
with a pre-defined Tenovi key). See https://tenovi.com/api-docs for a list of device-specific Properties.

All devices support a "measurement_webhook_id" property that configures a Device to only send measurement data to
a single Webhook (specified by that Webhook’s primary ID).

For device-specific settings, the "synced" field can be used to check if the setting has been successfully
applied to the device or not. Note, syncing often requires the device to connect to our network, which, for
some devices, only occurs when a measurement is taken).

get.summary: Lists all or Reads a single HWI Device
get.description: To read a single HWI Device, the ID must be included in the URL.

put.description:
The object ID must be included in the url for updates.

Only the Patient object can be updated. All other fields will be ignored.

Note, when updating a Patient object, if you update the external_id, only the current Device will be updated.
If the new external_id is already assigned to another Patient object, that existing Patient will be linked to
the updated Device with its existing fields updated using the data provided in the update request.

If you update any other fields (e.g. name or phone_number) without changing the external_id, those fields will
be updated for ALL Devices linked to the Patient object with that external_id.

If you wish to remove a Patient from a device, set the Patient object to null. This will not affect any other
Devices linked to the Patient object with that external_id.

Please note, the patient_id and patient_phone_number fields are deprecated in favor of the nested Patient
object. They remain available for backwards compatibility, but may lead to unpredictable behavior if you
include both these fields and the Patient object in an update request.

patch.description:
The object ID must be included in the url for updates.

Only the patient_id and patient_phone_number fields can be updated. All other fields will be ignored.

delete.summary: Deactivates a HWI Device by removing it completely from a Client's account.
delete.description:
Note, HWI Devices with a Fulfillment Request cannot be deleted once that Request has been fulfilled. In this
case, use the /unlink-gateway/ endpoint to deactivate a HWI Device. Charges may apply for any HWI Device
with an active Gateway linked to it.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this Client Devices.

get.summary: Get useful information about gateways that have been previously associated with your account.
get.description:
NOTE, This endpoint can only be used for retrieving information about gateways that have either been
previously linked with one or more of your own devices (e.g. via an Activation/Fulfillment request) or
Pre-Activated via a bulk order.
It can NOT be used to "pre-validate" a gateway ID that is not already associated with your account.

For the last_signal_strength field, a signal strength value of 30 or above is considered excellent,
while a signal strength value of 10 or below is considered poor.

For the "ordering" query parameter, valid options are "assigned_on", "shipped_on", and "last_measurement".
Prepend a "-" to order by descending values (e.g. "-last_measurement"). Default is -assigned_on.

Results are paginated. Use the page_size and page fields to modify the pagination settings.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

get.summary: Get useful information about gateways that have been previously associated with your account.
get.description:
NOTE, This endpoint can only be used for retrieving information about gateways that have either been
previously linked with one or more of your own devices (e.g. via an Activation/Fulfillment request) or
Pre-Activated via a bulk order.
It can NOT be used to "pre-validate" a gateway ID that is not already associated with your account.

For the last_signal_strength field, a signal strength value of 30 or above is considered excellent,
while a signal strength value of 10 or below is considered poor.

For the "ordering" query parameter, valid options are "assigned_on", "shipped_on", and "last_measurement".
Prepend a "-" to order by descending values (e.g. "-last_measurement"). Default is -assigned_on.

Results are paginated. Use the page_size and page fields to modify the pagination settings.

get.summary: Lists all or reads a single Patient object
get.description:
The client-provided "external_id" field must be used as the lookup field for direct GET requests.

This endpoint can be used for getting and updating data on patient objects directly.

If a full address has been provided, the address_status field will indicate if that address has been Verified
or is Invalid.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

post.description:
The external_id field is required and must be unique for each patient.

If a full address is provided, our system will attempt to verify it.
This internal verification process can be overruled by setting the "confirm_address" flag to True.

get.summary: Lists all or reads a single Patient object
get.description:
The client-provided "external_id" field must be used as the lookup field for direct GET requests.

This endpoint can be used for getting and updating data on patient objects directly.

If a full address has been provided, the address_status field will indicate if that address has been Verified
or is Invalid.

put.description:
The client-provided "external_id" field must be used as the lookup field for PUT/PATCH requests.

If the patient's address if modified, our system will attempt to verify it.
This internal verification process can be overruled by setting the "confirm_address" flag to True.

patch.description:
The client-provided "external_id" field must be used as the lookup field for PUT/PATCH requests.

If the patient's address if modified, our system will attempt to verify it.
This internal verification process can be overruled by setting the "confirm_address" flag to True.

delete.summary: Lists all or reads a single Patient object
delete.description:
The client-provided "external_id" field must be used as the lookup field for direct GET requests.

This endpoint can be used for getting and updating data on patient objects directly.

If a full address has been provided, the address_status field will indicate if that address has been Verified
or is Invalid.

get.summary: Lists all Replacements.
get.description: Use the query parameter "fulfilled" to filter your responses by Replacement Requests that have been fulfilled or not.

post.summary: Creates a new Replacement Order for a given Client Device
post.description:
This endpoint can be used to request a replacement Device, Gateway, or both. Simply include an array of objects
with a name field indicating the Device you wish to be shipped in the device_types field. For Gateway
replacements, simply use "Gateway" as the device name.

Note, the hwi_device_id is required in order for the replacement to be linked to an underlying HWI Device.
If you are requesting a replacement Gateway, Tenovi will automatically update the hardware_uuid of any
HWI Devices linked to the same Gateway as the referenced HWI Device. Our system will send a Fulfillment
Webhook with the updated Gateway ID when the replacement is shipped.

The "notify_emails" field can include comma-separated email addresses; shipping updates will be sent to this
list

delete.description: Note, Replacements cannot be deleted once they have been fulfilled

get.summary: Lists all measurement data for a given patient id.
get.description:
The patient_id value used during HWI Device creation must be included in the url.

Note, the "timestamp" field represents the time the measurement was actually taken, as measured by the device.
The "created" field represents the time the measurements was created on our server. For backwards compatibility,
the MEASUREMENT Webhook posts the "timestamp" value with both the "timestamp" and "created" key, which may not
match the "created" value returned here. Please note the difference between these two fields when filtering via
query parameters.

post.description:
Resends measurement data to all webhooks for the specified event. Requires a `measurement_id` to be passed,
and optionally target `webhook_ids`.

post.summary: Sends test data to all webhooks for the specified event.
post.description: The data fields are optional, but can be used to set specific values to be used in the test data.

get.summary: Unlinks a Gateway from a HWI Device
get.description:
The root HWI Device id must be included in the URL. If successful, the HWI Device object will be returned with
the device.hardware_uuid field set to NULL. At this point, that Gateway can be re-used with a new HWI Device.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this Client Devices.

get.summary: Lists all or Reads a single Webhook.
get.description:
MEASUREMENT webhooks will fire whenever a new measurement is received by the Tenovi platform from any
activated HWI Device. The MEASUREMENT webhook will POST the following json data to the provided endpoint. Note,
this endpoint can be configured to POST data as an array of JSON data, with related measurements (e.g, pulse
and blood pressure readings captured in a single BPM reading) grouped together in the same array.

Note, MEAUSUREMENT webhooks can also be globally disabled or enabled using the enabled_by_default flag. The
measurement_webhook_id clientDeviceProperty can be used to selectively enable a measurement webhook for a
specific device, even if that Webhook is not enabled by default.

    {
      "metric": "metric_name", // see tenovi.com/hwi-device-overview/ for a list of valid metric_names per device
      "device_name": "device_name", // the name of the Device used to take this measurement
      "hwi_device_id": "12345678-abcd-1234-abcd-1234567890ab", // the primary id returned on hwi device activation
      "patient_id": "patient_id", // the patient.external_id value provided during hwi-device creation
      "hardware_uuid": "1234abcd5678", // Tenovi Gateway ID or other Hardware Identifier (e.g. IMEI)
      "sensor_code": "", // the Sensor Code of the device used to take this measurement
                         // For devices that require sensor_ids, this field will be "[sensor_code]-[sensor_id]"
      "value_1": "100.00", // The primary reading value, formatted as a 2-decimal point string
      "value_2": "0.00",  // A secondary value (when applicable) See tenovi.com/hwi-device-overview/ for details
      "timestamp": "2022-01-25T14:35:46.198000Z", // The time the measurement was taken, as measured by the device
      "timezone_offset": -7, // Difference (in hours) between TZ where measurement was taken and UTC
      "created": "2022-01-25T14:35:46.198Z000", // The time the measurement was received by our server, in UTC
      "estimated_timestamp": False, // Boolean indicating if the 'timestamp' field is an algorithmic estimate,
                                    // which is used if the timestamp from the device is in an invalid range
      "filter_params": {} // JSON data of key-value pairs. See tenovi.com/hwi-device-overview/ for details
    }

FULFILLMENT webhooks will fire whenever a Fulfillment Request associated with a HWI Device is updated.
The FULFILLMENT webhook will post the following json data to the provided endpoint:

    {
      "patient_id": "patient_id", // The patient.external_id value set during hwi-device creation
      "device_name": "device_name", // see hwi-devices for valid device names
      "hwi_device_id": "12345678-abcd-1234-abcd-1234567890ab", // the root id returned on HWI Device creation
      "device_id": "4321DCBA8765", // For "Replaced" or "Unlinked" webhooks only, indicates the PRIOR hardware_uuid
      "hardware_uuid": "1234abcd5678", // The current Tenovi Gateway ID or other Hardware Identifier for this device
      "sensor_code": "", // see hwi-devices for valid sensor codes
      "status": "status", // Readable fulfillment status: Pending Shipment, Dropship Requested, Shipped,
                          // Dropshipped, Delivered, Returned, Connected, Replaced, or Unlinked
      "tracking_link": // The tracking link for this device, if it has been shipped
    }

post.description:
If an auth_header is required, the full Authorization header must be included in the auth_header field
(e.g. "Token XXXXX" or "Bearer XXXXXX").

The default header key for the auth_header value is "Authorization". If you need a different header key,
include it in the "auth_key" field.

The "event" field must be set to either "MEASUREMENT" or "FULFILLMENT" to create a Webhook for the
corresponding event type.

The "post_as_array" field only applies to MEASUREMENT webhooks.

get.summary: Lists all or Reads a single Webhook.
get.description:
MEASUREMENT webhooks will fire whenever a new measurement is received by the Tenovi platform from any
activated HWI Device. The MEASUREMENT webhook will POST the following json data to the provided endpoint. Note,
this endpoint can be configured to POST data as an array of JSON data, with related measurements (e.g, pulse
and blood pressure readings captured in a single BPM reading) grouped together in the same array.

Note, MEAUSUREMENT webhooks can also be globally disabled or enabled using the enabled_by_default flag. The
measurement_webhook_id clientDeviceProperty can be used to selectively enable a measurement webhook for a
specific device, even if that Webhook is not enabled by default.

    {
      "metric": "metric_name", // see tenovi.com/hwi-device-overview/ for a list of valid metric_names per device
      "device_name": "device_name", // the name of the Device used to take this measurement
      "hwi_device_id": "12345678-abcd-1234-abcd-1234567890ab", // the primary id returned on hwi device activation
      "patient_id": "patient_id", // the patient.external_id value provided during hwi-device creation
      "hardware_uuid": "1234abcd5678", // Tenovi Gateway ID or other Hardware Identifier (e.g. IMEI)
      "sensor_code": "", // the Sensor Code of the device used to take this measurement
                         // For devices that require sensor_ids, this field will be "[sensor_code]-[sensor_id]"
      "value_1": "100.00", // The primary reading value, formatted as a 2-decimal point string
      "value_2": "0.00",  // A secondary value (when applicable) See tenovi.com/hwi-device-overview/ for details
      "timestamp": "2022-01-25T14:35:46.198000Z", // The time the measurement was taken, as measured by the device
      "timezone_offset": -7, // Difference (in hours) between TZ where measurement was taken and UTC
      "created": "2022-01-25T14:35:46.198Z000", // The time the measurement was received by our server, in UTC
      "estimated_timestamp": False, // Boolean indicating if the 'timestamp' field is an algorithmic estimate,
                                    // which is used if the timestamp from the device is in an invalid range
      "filter_params": {} // JSON data of key-value pairs. See tenovi.com/hwi-device-overview/ for details
    }

FULFILLMENT webhooks will fire whenever a Fulfillment Request associated with a HWI Device is updated.
The FULFILLMENT webhook will post the following json data to the provided endpoint:

    {
      "patient_id": "patient_id", // The patient.external_id value set during hwi-device creation
      "device_name": "device_name", // see hwi-devices for valid device names
      "hwi_device_id": "12345678-abcd-1234-abcd-1234567890ab", // the root id returned on HWI Device creation
      "device_id": "4321DCBA8765", // For "Replaced" or "Unlinked" webhooks only, indicates the PRIOR hardware_uuid
      "hardware_uuid": "1234abcd5678", // The current Tenovi Gateway ID or other Hardware Identifier for this device
      "sensor_code": "", // see hwi-devices for valid sensor codes
      "status": "status", // Readable fulfillment status: Pending Shipment, Dropship Requested, Shipped,
                          // Dropshipped, Delivered, Returned, Connected, Replaced, or Unlinked
      "tracking_link": // The tracking link for this device, if it has been shipped
    }

put.description: The object ID must be included in the url for updates.

patch.description: The object ID must be included in the url for updates.

delete.summary: Lists all or Reads a single Webhook.

MEASUREMENT webhooks will fire whenever a new measurement is received by the Tenovi platform from any

      "hardware_uuid": "1234abcd5678", // Tenovi Gateway ID or other Hardware Identifier (e.g. IMEI)
      "sensor_code": "", // the Sensor Code of the device used to take this measurement
                         // For devices that require sensor_ids, this field will be "[sensor_code]-[sensor_id]"
      "value_1": "100.00", // The primary reading value, formatted as a 2-decimal point string
      "value_2": "0.00",  // A secondary value (when applicable) See tenovi.com/hwi-device-overview/ for details
      "timestamp": "2022-01-25T14:35:46.198000Z", // The time the measurement was taken, as measured by the device
      "timezone_offset": -7, // Difference (in hours) between TZ where measurement was taken and UTC
      "created": "2022-01-25T14:35:46.198Z000", // The time the measurement was received by our server, in UTC

                                    // which is used if the timestamp from the device is in an invalid range
      "filter_params": {} // JSON data of key-value pairs. See tenovi.com/hwi-device-overview/ for details
    }

FULFILLMENT webhooks will fire whenever a Fulfillment Request associated with a HWI Device is updated.
The FULFILLMENT webhook will post the following json data to the provided endpoint:

    {
      "patient_id": "patient_id", // The patient.external_id value set during hwi-device creation
      "device_name": "device_name", // see hwi-devices for valid device names
      "hwi_device_id": "12345678-abcd-1234-abcd-1234567890ab", // the root id returned on HWI Device creation
      "device_id": "4321DCBA8765", // For "Replaced" or "Unlinked" webhooks only, indicates the PRIOR hardware_uuid
      "hardware_uuid": "1234abcd5678", // The current Tenovi Gateway ID or other Hardware Identifier for this device
      "sensor_code": "", // see hwi-devices for valid sensor codes
      "status": "status", // Readable fulfillment status: Pending Shipment, Dropship Requested, Shipped,
                          // Dropshipped, Delivered, Returned, Connected, Replaced, or Unlinked
      "tracking_link": // The tracking link for this device, if it has been shipped
    }

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this Webhooks.
